website_summaries.verdict: Although this landscape rake has some limitations, it's a good choice if you need one capable of grabbing small objects.
pros: Has a solid, sturdy build that is typical of the company's craftsmanship
The perfect rake for removing small items like pebbles or debris from landscaping, thanks to design of the tines
cons: Not ideal for raking larger items
Weeds have the tendency to get stuck around the tines

customer_reviews.title: Makes my life easier
customer_reviews.text: This rake is very heavy duty and at 36 inches, it's big enough to get around my gravel quite quickly. One thing that I found annoying was that I needed to contact support about a bolt that was missing and the information provided by amazon was incorrect. No one at that company knows a thing about this rake, nor do they support it. I was able to find the manufacturer and contact them directly. They were extremely helpful. If you have problems, look up seymour midwest.
customer_reviews.author: Kabuki

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, purdy and effective
customer_reviews.text: If you like raking as much as I do, you will likely enjoy raking with this rake. When you cast the rake out in front of you and pull it towards you, material on the ground is moved towards you. It's a satisfying product in this sense, almost magical. It also appears to be an effective tool for keeping zombies and zoned out meth heads at bay. I will update my review as I have more experience in this area. Nothing has fallen off this rake, and that includes the attractive paint. No gripes about hand grip. General hand feel and weight are good to good+.
customer_reviews.author: Brice D.

customer_reviews.title: Good rake, nice handle.
customer_reviews.text: Good rake for sifting the yard of rocks prior to getting sod. On another note, it came via postal service. I live in the country with a rural mail box. If it doesnt fit in the mailbox, then it's a drive to the post office.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Broggi

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for dirt and gravel. Should have bought one years ago.
customer_reviews.text: I just built a 6 foot wide path down a steep slope. The soil is pretty rocky and the mini excavator ripped up the path pretty well. After a pass with this tool it looks great. The rake brings the rocks to the surface so the can be removed. It leaves a nice smooth surface. Should have bought one of these years ago.
customer_reviews.author: M. Schwager

customer_reviews.title: A solid rake
customer_reviews.text: A rake's a rake, right? Unfortunately, that isn't always the case. This rake is great. It is sturdy and easy to assemble. with one person. I haven't used it roughly, but it's been rock solid for what I've done with it.
customer_reviews.author: SM

customer_reviews.title: Also called a Rock-Rake..A must have tool in any garage.
customer_reviews.text: In Arizona we called them rock rakes for gravel, sand and such. Very sturdy and light weight. Good move on adding braces. Great tool to rip out the snarled. NOBODY borrows it!!
customer_reviews.author: The SakDaddyTop Contributor: Drums

customer_reviews.title: OK Sand Rake
customer_reviews.text: The rake is used for grooming our beach. The spacing between the tines is OK for large weeds, but smaller weeds pass through.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It does a great job and is just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: This was for me to clean out my pond. It does a great job and is just what I needed.
customer_reviews.author: Nell Maxwell

customer_reviews.title: Works great for sifting through beach sand
customer_reviews.text: We have a lake front sandy beach but we periodically need to pull weeds to keep he vegetation from growing in. After weeding manually I wait a day and use this rake to sift through the sand to remove the dried plants and roots that got left behind during weeding. This rake works very well for that. The straight edge blade also works well for pushing sand. I use it for leveling after my kids are done digging holes for their sand castle building. The rake seems well constructed although I'm not a commercial user of it. The aluminum handle with rubber grip are comfortable to use. Very satisfied with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: FallGuy

customer_reviews.title: It really works great for lake
customer_reviews.text: we get a lot for weeds when the wind blows hard. This rake hangs on to the weeds while I pull them out into the lake. It really works great for lake weeds
customer_reviews.author: Unknown

customer_reviews.title: It seens to be a solid piece of equipment but ...
customer_reviews.text: It seens to be a solid piece of equipment but It only removes the green muk that builds up on the weeds, it doesn't remove the weeds itself The teeth are too far apart, it just combs right over them
customer_reviews.author: PaulaJB

customer_reviews.title: Yup
customer_reviews.text: Worked great! As described. No issues besides the rubber grip fell off pretty fast. Doesn't matter though
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: I love the rake. The only remarkable thing is the screws that seem to easily come undone.
customer_reviews.author: Novellou

customer_reviews.title: Well made product
customer_reviews.text: This product is very well made. Handle is sturdy and attaches well to the rake, very easy to assemble and is packaged well. I use this as a sand rake on the beach and it is very effective. Good quality, highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: MWPWired

customer_reviews.title: good quailty
customer_reviews.text: works good to clean debris and rocks from sand, built sturdy and easy to assemble
customer_reviews.author: Anthony P. Simone

customer_reviews.title: but good quality
customer_reviews.text: Heavier than I expected and hard to use , but good quality
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Birkholz

customer_reviews.title: Great beach rake
customer_reviews.text: Great beach rake. Pulls out all the pine needles and rocks leaving the sand beautiful. Works wonderful on the rocky sand beachside in Maine.
customer_reviews.author: F. Uccellini

customer_reviews.title: Clean up well...
customer_reviews.text: The rake worked very well on our beach, and in the lake too.
customer_reviews.author: Richard W. Davis

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty rake that works great.
customer_reviews.text: Heavy duty rake at a reasonable price. Handle is bolted in place and very sturdy. It works great for removing weeds from our lake.
customer_reviews.author: Fisherman R

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Work great on our beach. Pulls up rocks and debris.
customer_reviews.author: KristineN

customer_reviews.title: Great Beach Rake!
customer_reviews.text: works great 2 options and isn't too heavy we use it for commercial use and no complaints at all and the price is very fair!!!
customer_reviews.author: Deber

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great rake and definitely tears up small roots in the sand as well. Good product for a fair price!
customer_reviews.author: Peter M.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Well made, perfectly designed for a large sandy area of a beach house
customer_reviews.author: Skillman

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is a high quatilty rake. My beach at the lake has never been so rock free!!!!
customer_reviews.author: David Christiansen

customer_reviews.title: Very User Friendly
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect rake for my pond and my cottage at the lake. The only issue I have is the rake has sharp edges as it must be stamped out. I just filed her up to get rid of these sharp edges. I like it!
customer_reviews.author: steven stankevitz

customer_reviews.title: Be careful: Razor sharp burr on metal tines!
customer_reviews.text: Great rake, but they don't file down the machine burr on the edge of the tines prior to shipment. These will wear away with time if you are raking sand or light gravel, but until then they are razor sharp and it's very easy to slice open your finger handling the head with your hands.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Thatcher

product_meta.title: Midwest Rake Company 11036 Screening Rake
product_meta.description: Designed with special non-gouging rounded teeth, the Screening Rake is great for sifting stones, glass, and sticks as well as smoothing and leveling surfaces. Features 36" aluminum head with large striking edge for pushing action.
feature_bullets: 36" width high-grade aluminum / magnesium alloy head
66" x 1-1/8" diameter blue powder-coated aluminum handle with 6" green non-slip vinyl grip
Solid aluminum plug in the head-to-handle connection
36" width high-grade aluminum / magnesium alloy head
Solid aluminum plug in the head-to-handle connection
